text: Well, I was at work one day I was doing my usual job working on the warehouse floor stocking boxes organizing merchandise I had been working for a few hours it was getting late I had been feeling a bit strange
keypoint: I work late in the warehouse and begin to feel unwell

text: a bit lightheaded but chalked it up to hunger not having eaten yet that day But then, as I was walking around the warehouse returning items to their proper places I started to feel a strange tightness and pressure in my chest I stopped what I was doing
keypoint: My symptoms worsen and I realize something is wrong

text: leaned against a nearby wall for a bit the pressure only got stronger I could feel my heart pounding in my chest Next thing I know, I started seeing spots I could feel sweat dripping down my forehead my arms I tried to take some deep breaths I just couldn't catch my breath
keypoint: I struggle with chest pressure, dizziness, and fear

text: I was really scared didn't know what to do. Suddenly I heard a voice coming from across the warehouse. It was the manager who had seen me called out to me it seems someone had noticed me was checking to see if I was alright
keypoint: Overwhelmed and scared, I am noticed by my manager

text: I tried to yell back that something was wrong I couldn't find my voice. The manager started walking towards me I could feel my world going dark I started to drop to the ground luckily the manager got to me in time caught me just before my legs gave out He took me to the staff room
keypoint: Unable to call for help, I collapse but my manager intervenes

text: sat me down in a chair He asked me questions about what was wrong what happened He got me a glass of cold water told me to rest for a bit After a few minutes the pressure in my chest slowly eased up I started to feel better
keypoint: The manager cares for me until I recover from the episode

text: It turned out I had been having a panic attack I escaped from the situation the help of the quick action of the manager It was never a fun experience it really could have been much worse it taught me to check in with myself make sure to properly rest eat to avoid further episodes
keypoint: I learn I had a panic attack and reflect on self-care
